qas.question: What types of churches attract tourists to Palermo?
Which town is Sicily's primary industrial and commercial center?
What are Palermo's four main industrial sectors?
What city is Italy's cultural , economic, and tourist capital?
Who likes Palermo's sub tropical weather?
What city is main Italian industrial and cultural center?
Why is Palermo one of the largest cities in Europe?

context: <b3_0>Palermo<b3_0/> is Sicily's cultural, economic and touristic capital. It is a city rich in history, culture, art, music and food. Numerous <b4_0>tourists<b4_0/> are attracted to the city for its good Mediterranean weather, its renowned gastronomy and restaurants, its <a0_0>Romanesque, Gothic and Baroque<a0_0/> churches, palaces and buildings, and its nightlife and music. <a1_0><b5_0>Palermo<b5_0/><a1_0/> is the main Sicilian industrial and commercial center: the main industrial sectors include <a2_0>tourism, services, commerce and agriculture<a2_0/>. Palermo currently has an international airport, and a significant underground economy.[citation needed] In fact, for <b6_0>cultural, artistic and economic reasons<b6_0/>, Palermo was one of the largest cities in the Mediterranean and is now among the top tourist destinations in both Italy and Europe. The city is also going through <b7_0>careful redevelopment<b7_0/>, preparing to become one of the major cities of the Euro-Mediterranean area.
